page.title: 06Wivelsfield - Education (1)
page.content:
{Wivelsfield C.P.}has between 90 and 100 children from the ages of 4\ to 11, divided into four classes. Two of the classes are in the original school building which is about 100 years old and two are in 'mobile' classrooms.
The school has close ties with {Wivelsfield Parish Church}and is able to use the nearby Church Hall for school meals, P.E. and plays.
The{Parent-Teacher Association}exists to forge closer links between parents and staff and to raise funds for 'extras' not provided by the Education Authority.
Before starting school, most children attend the local playgroup. After they reach 11 they go on to Chailey Comprehensive School 3 miles away.
